body:
I've tried your gestures as well as many others but haven't been able to reproduce using a clean new project on a Nexus 5X.

Have you been able to test and reproduce on a different device?

One small thing regarding executable code is that it depends on a not provided skin asset. I would suggest removing the Skin alltogether and simply create the Label like this which uses embedded libGDX arial font:

```label = new Label("Not touched!", new Label.LabelStyle(new BitmapFont(), Color.WHITE));```
Updated the code according to your proposal. I don't have any other devices, but will look out for some to test on.

Settings--Additional Settings--Buttons and Gesture Shortcuts apparently. 
But you can google for your model and see where to do it. There was a similar issue with HTC One's where their multi-gesture layer was breaking multi touch.

@Tom-Ski oh thank you so much! i turned off this function: make a screenshoot when swipe down with 3 fingers.
I think, I'ill add a notification to my game, about disabling gestures to avoid this glitch

This didn't solve it for me. I've tried using the Godot engine instead of this framework and the issue is not present there. (doesn't that mean this shouldn't be device related?) If I'm wrong, I will probably just use the Godot engine instead.
Maybe the gestures could be disabled from inside of the application?

Ok, I have been able to reproduce the issue on a Samsung Galaxy S7. 

Unfortunately disabling gestures doesn't fix it and has been reported previously by other users always affecting Samsung devices:

The key issue as described by another user is that as soon as the palm is down an ACTION_CANCEL occurs (with several [ViewRootImpl] action cancel -1 logs displayed) and the app cannot properly clean up the touch-point records because the ACTION_UP or ACTION_POINT_UP events will not be received.

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/25492112/motionevent-action-cancel-is-blocking-subsequent-action-up-on-my-button
https://stackoverflow.com/questions/45281345/android-studio-d-viewrootimpl-viewrootimpl-action-cancel
https://developer.samsung.com/forum/thread/a/201/271485

The only workaround I can think of is to clear all touches if an ACTION_CANCEL is received but I'm not sure about the consequences and if ACTION_CANCEL is triggered in other situations.

***EDIT*** Reading the documentation it seems that ACTION_CANCEL means the entire gesture is cancelled so I guess it makes sense to clear all other touches

issue.title: Fixes #5191. Clear touch points on Android multi-touch ACTION_CANCEL event
issue.body:
Fixes #5191. Please see last comment on issue for explanation.

Tested on Samsung Galaxy S7 and Nexus 5X with libGDX test MultiTouchTest
